entry.title: SAP minor update
entry.content: When receiving a notification about a minor upgrade in SAP S/4 HANA Public Cloud (e.g., https://me.sap.com/notes/3374323/E), is it correct to understand that in S/4 HANA Public Cloud the upgrade is performed automatically, and there is no need to carry out any additional maintenance work?

entry.content:

Is it possible to change that value via custom logic?

Best Regards,

Khaing Zin

entry.title: Fixed Asset Migration with Asset Sub number errors
entry.content:
Hi you guys,

When performing the master fixed asset migration, I encountered an error for assets with sub-numbers other than 0 (such as 1, 2, 3 — internally numbered). The error message says:

“Main asset xxxxxx does not exist in company code xxxx” (Error code: FAA_MD 35).

I have already included the main asset (with subnumber = 0) together with the sub-assets (1, 2, 3) in the same migration file, and also tried migrating the main asset (subnumber = 0) first and then the sub-assets separately. However, the error still persists.

If anyone knows how to resolve this issue, could you please guide me?

Thank you so much.

entry.title: Mass PO Print
entry.content:
Dear SAP Support,

 

We are currently using SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, and we would like to implement mass printing of Purchase Orders (POs). Our requirement is to trigger the print output for multiple POs at once, ideally in a scheduled or background process, and send them to a defined print queue or generate PDF output.
We are looking for a step-by-step procedure that covers:
Setup and configuration of print queues
Output parameter determination for Purchase Orders
Usage of the Print Scheduled Purchase Orders (App ID F3461)
Integration with SAP Cloud Print Manager (CPM)
Monitoring and handling of print queue items
(If possible) Options for downloading PO outputs in bulk as PDF
We would also like to understand the standard limitations in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition regarding bulk printing or mass PDF download, and whether any SAP-provided extensibility options or APIs exist for this scenario.
Please provide detailed guidance, relevant documentation, or best practices that would help us enable this functionality in our tenant.

 

Thank you in advance for your support.

 

Best regards,




------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Unable to Connect SAP Business Application Studio and SAP Public Cloud
entry.content:
I closely followed the SAP blog Connect SAP Business Application Studio and SAP S/4HANA Cloud system and the end result is an "Authentication incorrect. Please check the SAP BTP destination authentication configuration." error. What other configuration is needed to connect BAS to a Public Cloud system if they are in different global BTP cockpit accounts?

Shown in the screenshot above, The BTP BAS destination is available but not able to authenticate to the public cloud system. The destination and communication system trust has been configured per the SAP blog.  Any ideas how how to enable cross-global account BAS connectivity?


 

__PRESENT

__PRESENT

entry.title: Generate PDF form on S/4HANA Cloud, public edition from BTP app
entry.content:
I’m building a BTP CAP application which should retrieve the PDF printout of an Outbound Delivery (FDP_V2_DELIVERY_NOTE_V1 template )out of an S/4HANA Cloud, public edition system.

Since no direct API exists (like for billing documents Overview | Billing Document - Read, Cancel, GetPDF | SAP Business Accelerator Hub), as per my understanding I’m left with three options:

  1. Recreate the same form I have on S/4HANA on BTP with SAP Forms Service by Adobe
  2. Get the PDF directly from CA_OC_OUTPUT_REQUEST_SRV Service
  3. Create a small custom ABAP service to be called from BTP which, given a specific delivery number, could return a PDF

I tried all those routes, but couldn’t succeed for various reasons:

  1. SAP Forms Service by Adobe
    1. it seems I can’t reuse the layout I made since the service only accept only one file, whereas mine is comprised of a master form and a content for
    2. even if I could recreate it from scratch I don't know how I can get data out of the standard Data Provider (FDP_V2_DELIV_NOTE_LO_GLO_GEN_SRV) to pass it to the layout
  2. this does not seem to be a released API, therefore I think I could have a problem with Communication Arrangement technical user
  3. on Premise FM like ‘FP_JOB_OPEN’ etc.. are obviously forbidden, so I tried with proper classes like cl_fp_form_reader like suggested in Note 3355397 - No support for custom form templates in S/4 HANA Cloud Developer Extensibility - SAP for Me, however,  since the form was created using Maintain Form Template App, I tried to create in ADT, but no standard Data Provider can be chosen and I can’t even create my own copy with the proper annotations (as explained in note 3650179 - [2508] Cannot select data provider in ADT Form dialog - SAP for Me) because I can’t open SEGW on a Public Cloud environment.

I’ve hit a dead end. Can someone share a tip?

entry.title: List of Product in Storage Location (SAP Cloud, Public Edition)
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I am looking for an app that displays a list of products that are maintained in a storage location.

The app Product List (F6518) exist but only displays product maintained at plant-level, equivalent to MM60.
The app Display Warehouse Stock (MB52) has been depreciated in version 2508.
The app Stock - Multiple Materials (F1595) only displays products that are active (with goods movements).

I am also aware of the CDS View I_ProductStorageLocationBasic  but this is not something we can provide to our end users.

Hope you can help me on this! Thank you.

MM (Materials Management) MM Inventory Management SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

entry.title: CDS View for Tax Date
entry.content:
Hello,

we are using TDT and we need a report which shows the tax date or at least the tax rate, which is valid for a posting line item.

Unfortunately I did not find any report or CDS View which includes this fields.

Is there any possibility to get this information?

BR
Mona

entry.title: In SAP Public Cloud, there is an issue in sales order pricing.
entry.content: In Sap public cloud In sales order pricing, there is a manual condition type ZPR1 used for the base price. Currently, the system allows entering this condition type multiple times in the same line item. These multiple entries are added together in the pricing calculation, which can result in incorrect totals. For example, if ZPR1 is entered twice — once for ₹100 and again for ₹300 — the system calculates a total of ₹400, which is incorrect. but we need it only allowing one time.

entry.title: Asset quantity update in mass
entry.content:
We need to update the quantity of asset master's in mass, but no such application is available in sap public cloud to update quantity in mass. Only one app is available, but it updates one asset at a time, it's App Post Asset Acquisition - And Quantity Adjustment (F6488)

 

Please provide a solution on this.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.content:
For example, both transaction and global currency are EUR but the amounts differ in a posting.

entry.title: Maintenance Order Not Showing in Capacity Scheduling Board (SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition)
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I’m currently working on SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition, and I’m facing an issue with the capacity scheduling integration between Maintenance (PM) and Production (PP).

Here’s my scenario:

  • I created a maintenance order for an intervention on an equipment located on a production line.

  • The operation duration was set to 1 hour.

  • I released the order and confirmed that a work center was assigned at the operation level.

  • The work center is the same one used for the production line (so that the maintenance activity should ideally impact the production capacity).

However, when I open the Capacity Scheduling Board (production scheduling application):

  • The available capacity remains unchanged,

  • The graph does not show any maintenance order,

  • Even though the legend includes “Work Orders”, nothing is displayed on the chart.

I already checked the following:

Order is released (REL)
Equipment has a valid work center assigned 

Still, the maintenance order does not appear on the capacity scheduling chart.

My questions to the community:

  1. Should maintenance orders appear in the production capacity scheduling board, or are they visible only in the Maintenance Scheduling Board?

  2. If it’s possible to visualize PM orders in the production capacity board, what configuration is required (order type, capacity category, or work center linkage)?

  3. Is there any restriction in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition that prevents PM orders from influencing PP capacity load?

Any insights or experiences would be greatly appreciated 

Thanks in advance,

KHARBOUCH Mohamed

entry.title: Unable to exclude BankDetails segment from Business Partner replication in S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hi all,

I’m currently working on an S/4HANA Public Cloud → SAP EWM integration using the standard communication arrangement SAP_COM_0008 (Business Partner, Customer and Supplier Integration).

During testing, I noticed that bank information of suppliers is automatically included in the outbound payload, even though this data should not be shared with EWM.

Below is an excerpt of the payload (from the interface BusinessPartnerSUITEBulkReplicateRequest

<BankDetails actionCode="04"> <ID>0001</ID> <BankDirectoryReference> <BankStandardID>ABNANL2A</BankStandardID> <BankCountryCode>NL</BankCountryCode> <BankInternalID>ABNANL2A</BankInternalID> </BankDirectoryReference> <BankAccountStandardID>NL27ABNA0617417393</BankAccountStandardID> <ValidityPeriod> <StartDate>2025-10-14</StartDate> <EndDate>9999-12-31</EndDate> </ValidityPeriod> </BankDetails>

These are the fields that are sent by default:

  • BankStandardID (BIC)

  • BankCountryCode

  • BankInternalID

  • BankAccountStandardID (IBAN)

  • ID (bank record ID)

  • ValidityPeriod

Issue:

In DRF (Data Replication Framework) I reviewed both the Main Filters and Segment Filters under the replication model 986_000 (Business Partner).
While I can maintain filters for company code, sales area, tax grouping, etc., there is no segment filter for Bank Details (BUT0BK) visible.
This means the <BankDetails> segment is always replicated.

Screenshots from my system show:

  • Main filters: LIFNR, BUKRS, EKORG, KTOKK, PARTNER, etc.

  • Segment filters: tax, company code, sales area, address usage, but no entry for BankDetails.

Question:

Is there any standard way (in S/4HANA Public Cloud) to exclude or suppress the BankDetails segment from Business Partner outbound replication?

I would like to avoid sending IBAN/BIC data to external or decentralized systems like EWM.
I can’t find a DRF filter object for it, and I’d prefer not to implement a custom BAdI unless absolutely necessary.

Any official guidance, SAP Note, or workaround (e.g., via Communication Arrangement setup, DRF customizing, or CDS-based filtering) would be very helpful.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Pack stock (not received) in to HU for Inbound Delivery
entry.content:
Hey, experts!

I have the requirement to pack stock from an Inbound Delivery (without GR posted yet) into HU(s) and then post GR for the HUs.
However when investigating the Handling Unit API https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/9ce855c709ce4f5c99b685903461106e/c732c70900c146918490110cc9f59d73.html?locale=en-US - , I saw that it is not possible to pack the stock without StockItemUUID (which does not yet exists as the stock is not yet physically in the warehouse). However it is possible to do it for Outbound deliveries but not for inbound:


How to go about this issue?

entry.title: Clarification on “Manage Memo Record 2.0” and Bank Account Opening Balance Behavior
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

According to the SAP Help Portal, the “FI – Bank Account Balance (Deprecated)” template has been deprecated, and SAP now recommends using the “Manage Memo Record 2.0” app to import the initial bank account balance.

Ref : FI - Bank account balance (deprecated) | SAP Help Portal

I have tried entering the bank accoount balance using the Manage Memo Record 2.0 app.
After the upload, the amount correctly appears in the Cash Flow Analyzer app for the respective bank account, which indicates the memo record is recognized by the system.

However, when I subsequently created the first bank statement in the system, the amount entered via Manage Memo Record 2.0 does not appear as the opening balance for that bank account in the statement.

Could anyone please clarify:

  1. Why the amount recorded via Manage Memo Record 2.0 is not reflected as the opening balance in the first bank statement?

Thank you very much for your guidance and support.

entry.title: Document type SU and tax codes do not correspond to same VAT register
entry.content:
Hi,
I’m record a clearing documet with Automatic Clearing App.
The document that I want ho clear is a customer invoice and a Bank reconciliation.

In test run the system don’t show any error,

but not in test run the system show the error “Document type SU and tax codes do not correspond to same VAT register”.

Can you tell me what the problem is and a suggestion to solve it?

 

Thanks
